support_summary: TFEB undergoes direct post-translational modification by SUMO1 (SUMOylation). This modification inhibits TFEB's transcriptional activity, thereby suppressing lysosomal biogenesis and autophagy. De-SUMOylation, in contrast, enhances TFEB activity.

functions.function: Inhibition of TFEB Transcriptional Activity by SUMOylation
functions.cellular_process: TFEB is post-translationally modified by the covalent attachment of SUMO1 to specific lysine residues. This SUMOylation event attenuates the transcriptional activity of TFEB.
functions.effect_description: SUMOylation of TFEB reduces its ability to bind to the promoters of its target genes, leading to decreased expression of genes involved in lysosomal biogenesis and autophagy.
biological_consequence: SUMO1-mediated SUMOylation of TFEB → Inhibition of TFEB transcriptional activity → Decreased expression of lysosomal & autophagy genes → Impaired lipid clearance in macrophages → Promotion of macrophage foam cell formation
specific_effects: Inhibits the transcriptional activity of TFEB.

evidence.paper_title: TFEB SUMOylation in macrophages accelerates atherosclerosis by promoting the formation of foam cells through inhibiting lysosomal activity
evidence.authors: Wang K, Zhou W, Hu G, Wang L, Cai R, Tian T
evidence.relevant_quote: Our study demonstrated that in AS, deSUMOylation of TFEB could inhibit the formation of macrophage foam cells through enhancing lysosomal biogenesis and autophagy...
